title: Orbex raises $20.8 million Series C extension
summary: Orbex, a company based in the United Kingdom developing a small launch vehicle, has raised $20.8 million to “ramp up” work on its long-delayed rocket.

title: Op-Ed: Human Health Research, the Key to the Commercial Space Revolution
summary: If one word can summarize the past five years of human spaceflight, it’s “commercialization.” The early 2020s have been defined by a dramatic shift in the way we think about space exploration, particularly as NASA moves beyond LEO to procure new capabilities for its groundbreaking Artemis program. In this time, a core tenet of NASA’s policy for the future has emerged: to enable an independent commercial economy in space, where recurring services drive continuous innovation and development. In this world, NASA is but one customer in a thriving space environment.

title: Sci-Fi Showdown at Space Symposium: Complete transcript of the Star Trek vs Star Wars debate
summary: Read the full transcript of the Star Wars versus Star Trek debate held during the 39th Space Symposium.

title: Astra considered bankruptcy as it struggled to raise cash
summary: Spacecraft propulsion and launch vehicle company Astra Space considered filing for bankruptcy several times in recent months as the company struggled to raise cash.

title: China to leverage growing commercial space sector to launch megaconstellations
summary: China will utilize expected launch capacity from the country’s emergent commercial space sector to help realize its megaconstellation plans.

title: Virgin Galactic proposes reverse stock split
summary: Virgin Galactic will ask shareholders to approve a reverse stock split intended to boost the falling share price of the suborbital spaceflight company.

title: Boeing says it will cut SLS workforce “due to external factors”
summary: "Boeing is reviewing and adjusting current staffing levels."

title: Suppliers struggle as military embraces small satellites
summary: Bottlenecks emerge in the space industrial base as companies adapt to new demands for faster, cheaper satellites.

title: SpaceX and Northrop are working on a constellation of spy satellites
summary: First launch of these operational vehicles may occur next month from California.

title: Canada extends MDA Space’s ISS robotics contract to 2030
summary: The Canadian Space Agency has awarded MDA Space a contract extension worth around $182 million to continue supporting robotics operations on the International Space Station until 2030.
